issue.title: Add toolchain for Raspberry Pi cross compilation
issue.body: I've successfully cross compiled this. Currently running it on my Raspberry Pi and will convert it to a non-draft pull request once it passes.

comment.body: All tests passed on my Raspberry Pi except `tests/test_sig qTesla-p-I` and `tests/test_sig qTesla-p-III`, both of which crashed with the error `*** stack smashing detected ***: <unknown> terminated`. I'm assuming this is related to #578.  I'm going to merge this and leave the crash to be resolved in #578.

issue.title: Picnic compilation fails for ARM
issue.body:
When building on ARM (#460), if `--disable-sig-picnic` is removed from `scripts/arm-cross-compile.sh`, the build fails.

Compilation of `src/sig/picnic/external/picnic_iml.c` fails on lines 427 and 539 with "undefined reference to `rpl_malloc`"

comment.body: Cross compilation to Raspberry Pi using the CMake toolchain in #618 works fine, and the resulting binaries run fine on a Raspberry Pi. Closing issue.

issue.title: Integrate Falcon from PQClean
issue.body:
Replaces #533

Depends on #559 

Fixes #529 

Includes a re-sync with PQClean

@dimisik Please take a look

comment.body:
@christianpaquin, @vsoftco Any ideas why the AppVeyor CI builds are timing out on this PR?  The only change is adding Falcon. Falcon is not as fast as e.g. Dilithium, but still faster than many SPHINCSes, so I don't know why the run time would jump from ~10 minutes in our nightlies (e.g. https://ci.appveyor.com/project/dstebila/liboqs/builds/30842350/job/pffd16s67cjr4799) to an hour+ (https://ci.appveyor.com/project/dstebila/liboqs/builds/30843053/job/j0x9n2o6fcs9h578).

Operation                      | Iterations | Total time (s) | Time (us): mean | pop. stdev | CPU cycles: mean          | pop. stdev
------------------------------ | ----------:| --------------:| ---------------:| ----------:| -------------------------:| ----------:

issue.title: Switch liboqs build to CMake
issue.body: @vsoftco I started to switch liboqs build to CMake, but only know how to do it on Linux/macOS. The Windows instructions and AppVeyor CI need to be updated.

comment.body:

issue.title: Switch liboqs build to CMake

comment.body:
> @dstebila @xvzcf When compiling as a shared library, I'm getting a whole bunch of OpenSSL-related linker errors at the end (although OpenSSL is properly detected and enabled on my side), like
> 
> [ 98%] Linking C shared library ../lib/liboqs.dylib
> Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
> "_BN_CTX_end", referenced from:
> _OQS_KEM_bike1_l1_cpa_ossl_add in openssl_utils.c.o

Is this when compiling liboqs?  Or when compiling the C++ wrapper?

issue.title: Switch liboqs build to CMake
issue.body: @vsoftco I started to switch liboqs build to CMake, but only know how to do it on Linux/macOS. The Windows instructions and AppVeyor CI need to be updated.

comment.body:
> @dstebila It's when compiling liboqs (not the wrapper)

On my macOS, the following command works fine: `cmake -GNinja -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..`

> > On my macOS, the following command works fine: `cmake -GNinja -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..`
